meanings.definition: A living organism that typically grows in soil and has leaves, stems, and roots.
meanings.sent1: The small plant in the pot needs sunlight to grow.
meanings.sent2: I watered the plant in the garden every morning.
meanings.sent3: The plant in the classroom started talking to the students.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a blooming plant, spreading joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The plant's green leaves danced in the gentle breeze, a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To put or set in the ground for growth.
meanings.sent1: She will plant the seeds in the garden tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Farmers plant crops in the fields during the spring.
meanings.sent3: He decided to plant a surprise kiss on her cheek.
meanings.sent4: The idea took root in his mind, planted by a passing conversation.
meanings.sent5: With determination, she planted her feet firmly on the ground, ready to face any challenge.

meanings.definition: A factory or place where an industrial process takes place.
meanings.sent1: The new car plant will provide many job opportunities in the town.
meanings.sent2: The manufacturing plant produces thousands of units every day.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate plant smelled like a sweet paradise.
meanings.sent4: The ideas flowed through his mind like a well-oiled plant, efficiently processing each thought.
meanings.sent5: The bustling plant hummed with activity, a symphony of productivity echoing through the halls.
